ygData.subject: Re: Hell level?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... A linguist should be aware that change is not intrinsically good.  If often happens at the expense of clarity and precision.  Part of lingusitic study is
ygData.messageBody:
At 10:29 AM 6/28/99 -0500, Talies the Wanderer wrote:
>I, on the other hand, am into Linguistics, so I embrace these new languages
>- even going so far as to create a glossary to assist others in learning
>the unique lingo of EverQuest.

A linguist should be aware that change is not intrinsically good. If often
happens at the expense of clarity and precision. Part of lingusitic study
is to distinguish improvement from degeneration.

>P.S. I haven't added 'proc' yet, because I'm unsure of it's origins...
>Anyone wanna help here?

It would indeed be interesting to know the origin of the word, but I would
still resist its adoption when existing words are more clear, appropriate,
and expressive.

Bob
